headline: Terex, Atkore, Wabash, Old Dominion Freight Line, and Alta Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks jumped in the morning session after an in-line inflation report fueled hopes for interest rate cuts and the U.S. and China agreed to extend their tariff truce. The Consumer Price Index (CPI), a key measure of inflation, came in largely as expected, holding steady at 2.7% year-over-year. This reading boosted investor optimism that the Federal Reserve will have room to lower interest rates at its next meeting, which could reduce borrowing costs for companies and consumers.

headline: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From Old Dominion Freight Line’s Q2 Earnings Call
summary: Old Dominion’s second quarter was marked by continued softness in freight demand, resulting in a negative market reaction. Management attributed the underperformance to a persistent downturn in domestic shipping activity, with tonnage per day declining and increased overhead costs impacting profitability. CEO Marty Freeman highlighted that, despite these challenges, the team maintained its strategy of prioritizing service quality and disciplined pricing to offset cost pressures. Freeman also not

headline: ODFL Q2 Deep Dive: Volume Weakness, Cost Inflation, and Market Share Focus Shape Outlook
summary: Freight carrier Old Dominion (NASDAQ:ODFL) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales falling 6.1% year on year to $1.41 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.27 per share was 1.2% below analysts’ consensus estimates.
